physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph of a lecture hall. The hall is filled with students in uniform, seated in rows. Two aisles separate the seats into three columns. There is a second mezanine level of seats above. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of lecture attendees
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Lectures and lecture courses Students
